sentence: *Medus uidit se in inimici potestatem uenisse*
answer: Medus saw that he had come into the control of the enemy. *uidit* is the verb of the head. *se* is the accusative subject. *uenisse* is the infinitive as main verb.

sentence: *uidit uirginem captiuam eximiae formae esse adductam*
answer: He saw that the captive maiden of exceptional beauty had been abduced. *uidit* is the verb of the head. *uirginem* is the accusative subject. *esse adductam* is the infinitive as main verb.
He saw Perseus had great virtue. *uidit* is the verb of the head. *Perseum* is the accusative subject. *habere* is the infinitive as main verb.
He said that he had been conceived by Apollo. *dixit* is the verb of the head. *se* is the accusative subject. *concepisse* is the infinitive as main verb.
He said that Iphigenia was the murderer of her brother. *dixit* is the verb of the head. *Iphigeniam* is the accusative subject. *esse* is the infinitive as main verb.

sentence: *illa se missam esse dixit a patre*
answer: She said that she was sent by her father. *dixit* is the verb of the head. *se* is the accusative subject. *missam esse* is the infinitive as main verb.
